programme.title: Hidden Wonders of Europe
programme.desc: Europe‚Äôs ancient landscapes have virtually disappeared, but some stretches remain. A rich mosaic of habitats still cover the country of Poland. Lush forests, vast lowlands and mountain peaks all team with life. But the wildlife here has to fight to survive. Sea eagles battle over breakfast, seasoned hunters adapt to extreme conditions, and a crafty caterpillar pulls off the ultimate heist.

programme.title: Hidden Wonders of Europe
programme.desc: The parched lands of the Iberian Peninsula give rise to snow-covered peaks, expanses of rare cork oak, and Europe‚Äôs only fog forest. Unique habitats, where species found nowhere else on earth fight for survival. Male Iberian Ibex face-off over females, a whiskered tern chick braves predator-infested waters, and settling the score for the Macaques of Gibraltar calls for kidnap.

programme.title: Wild Arabia
programme.desc: Discover Saudi Arabia‚Äôs rugged landscapes where wildlife ingeniously adapts to extreme conditions. Amid sun-scorched terrain, creatures endure searing sun, thin air, and toxic gases. Explore bone caves, and marvel at rock art depicting local fauna‚Äîdeadly scorpions, raucous baboons, charming chameleons, and endangered leopards. Their resilience mirrors the harsh beauty of Saudi Arabia‚Äôs environment.

programme.title: Africa's Deadly Kingdom
programme.desc: South Africa's West Coast. An unforgiving, volatile world pummelled by icy Atlantic waters and buffeted by howling winds. .

programme.desc: Large carnivores such as hyenas and wild dogs - equipped with savage canines and unrivalled tenacity - are capable of tearing their prey apart in seconds.

programme.title: Ultimate Animals Compilations
programme.desc: Crows are as smart as dolphins and can talk like parrots. Wolves can hunt for three days straight in a territory the size of Delaware..

programme.title: America's National Parks: Bears
programme.desc: Winter in America‚Äôs National Parks can be a wondrous sight, but the bears that call the parks home are deep in hibernation. The black bears, brown bears and polar bears awake in spring, they fight to find enough food and space to raise their families, while also battling the elements to survive. The black bears, brown bears and polar bears that live in the parks.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Indigenous educator Phil Breslin journeys down Australia‚Äôs rivers to find which riparian animal is most built to survive. His first encounter is with the duck-billed platypus, a peculiar and adorable monotreme, or egg-laying mammal. Phil then gets a grip on the ultra-slimy long-finned eel and learns of its extraordinary reproductive habits before finally catching a river-dwelling bull shark.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Indigenous educator Phil Breslin wanders into Australia‚Äôs woodlands to find the species most adapted for survival. Phil first encounters the yellow-bellied glider, an intrepid marsupial with a built-in wingsuit. Next is one of Australia‚Äôs most abundant but deadly reptiles, the eastern brown snake. Last but certainly not least, Phil finds the iconic, cuddly and oh-so-sleepy koala.

programme.title: Winter's Hidden Wonders
programme.desc: The harsh elements of the Americas' winter push animals to their limits. Only the toughest and most resourceful survive.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Doc Pol offers relief to a blind Jack Russel and helps a dairy cow stuck in labor. Later, the good doctor searches for footing after an amped up Angus sends him airborne. A 250+ pound potbelly gets pushy with Dr. Lisa, while Dr. Nicole grapples with an energetic husky. Dr. Brenda celebrates the holiday season with a skydiving Santa and his elves.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: Get ready to rumble! From brawling birds to hurting hooves, the vets swing into action mending paws, jaws, even a down on his luck duck. Doc wages an epic battle to save a cow struggling to give birth, Dr. Lisa treats a Husky hit by a truck, and Dr. Nicole examines a pack of puppies with a plethora of problems. The Pols welcome their newest fur baby, Christy, a rambunctious Bengal kitten.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: From a harrowing farrowing to an emergency kidding, the vets pull off miracles! There‚Äôs no pause in paws as Dr. Brenda and Dr. Lisa treat a variety of foot injuries, including a Sheltie with broken toes. Dr. Pol examines a massive mastiff with tummy trouble and an injured rabbit. The Pol family add a pregnant Friesian mare to the herd and Dr. Nicole has her hands full with a rooster and a cat.

programme.title: Animal Fight Club
programme.desc: Animal Fight Club presents another jaw-dropping adventure across the frozen landscapes of Scandinavia, the prehistoric jungles of Madagascar to the deadly deserts of Africa. In these treacherous terrains it's kill or be killed when angry elephants go on the rampage, hungry crocodiles fight ruthless lions and swarms of deadly ants battle to dismember each other - alive!.

programme.title: Animal Fight Club
programme.desc: Animal Fight Night: 'Plan of Attack' showcases nature's most brutal battle plans and how an intelligent attack can be the difference between victory and death. Using a mix of ultra-rare wildlife footage, exclusive user generated content and ground breaking computer animation, 'Plan of Attack' proves that in the wild, brain power can be as potent a weapon as muscle power..

programme.title: Animal Fight Club
programme.desc: Animals clash in brutal battles for survival. Leopards fued for territory, kingfishers spar for love, a baboon mom battles a crocodile..

programme.title: Animal Fight Club
programme.desc: In the wild, beasts of all sizes clash: From desperate Polar bears battling for supremacy, to river otters risking all in the jaws of a raging Black Caiman and foolish lions playing soccer with a no-holds barred honey badger. This is nature at its meanest: Stripped down to who dares wins, with power battles, biting frenzies, head clashes, kicking killers and wolves in sheep's clothing, it's Animal Fight Club..

programme.title: Secrets Of The Penguins
programme.desc: The emperors are the largest and strongest of all penguins, living in the coldest, most extreme place on Earth. National Geographic Explorer Bertie Gregory embeds with an Antarctic colony and encounters social skills never filmed before. As the planet rapidly warms, he discovers bonds forged from birth between family, friends and strangers are the difference between life and death. .

programme.title: Secrets Of The Octopus
programme.desc: Octopus are like aliens on earth but they have one superpower that we are only now beginning to fully appreciate. By changing their color hundreds of times an hour, or transforming the shape of their bodies to mimic their deadliest enemies, octopus are the most extraordinary shapeshifters on the planet.

programme.title: Giants of The Deep Blue
programme.desc: Pre-historic GIANTS roam the world's oceans. Go beneath the surface for an extraordinary look and listen at these majestic creatures..WHALES.
